what: Example 1: generate a dataset from a project
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: Assume project called myProj.dat willing generate dataset meeting reporting requirements IPCC. run function, generated automatically saved folder myProj.dat . newline
code: ## -- load gcamreport library. library(gcamreport)  ## -- store the project path in a variable. mypath <- "/path/to/project/myProj.dat" # Notice that the extension is included. Accepted extensions: .dat & .proj. # ATENTION: in case you followed the Docker installation, you should store your project data inside the  # gcamreport folder and your root directory is called "/app". Thus, your path will be something like "/app/myProj.dat".  ## -- generate the dataset until 2050.  run(project_path = mypath, final_year = 2050, launch_ui = FALSE) # Notice that it will automatically be saved in .csv and .xlsx at "/path/to/project/myproj_ipcc_report.csv" and "/path/to/project/myproj_ipcc_report.xlsx".  # The terminal will output the verifications done and their result.

what: Example 2: generate a dataset from a database
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: Assume database called myDb folder named dbFolder willing generate dataset meeting reporting requirements IPCC several scenarios: scen1, scen2, scen3. run function, generated automatically saved folder myDb . newline
code: ## -- load gcamreport library. library(gcamreport)  ## -- store the database path and name, the query path, the desired project name, and the considered scenarios in variables. dbpath <- "/path/to/database" dbname <- "gcamdb_name" querypath <- "/path/to/queries" projname <- "awesomeProj.dat" scen <- c('scen1', 'scen2', 'scen3') # Notice that the extension is included in the project name. Accepted extensions: .dat & .proj. # ATENTION: in case you followed the Docker installation, you should store your database inside the gcamreport folder and # your root directory is called "/app". Thus, your database path will be something like "/app/database".  ## -- generate the dataset until 2075.  run(db_path = dbpath, query_path = querypath, db_name = dbname, prj_name = projname, scenarios = scen, final_year = 2075, launch_ui = FALSE) # Notice that it will automatically be saved in .csv and .xlsx at "/path/to/database/awesomeProj_ipcc_report.csv" and "/path/to/database/awesomeProj_ipcc_report.xlsx". The terminal will output # the verifications done and their result.

what: Example 3: save the output in an specified format
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: Assume situation previous examples want save results either .csv .xlsx format. specify anything, formats automatically saved. newline
code: ## -- load gcamreport library. library(gcamreport)  ## -- use example1 or example2 project or database descriptions and add all the  extra parameters that you consider in the `run` function. Specify the output through the `save_output` parameter  ## -- save the dataset only in CSV format run(..., save_output = 'CSV')  ## -- save the dataset only in XLSX format run(..., save_output = 'XLSX')

title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: R console, might see error: problem due wrong path specification. Possible solution: make sure specified correctly path. addition: case using gcamreport package following R installation, try copy whole path data, instance C:\Users\username\Documents\path\\\data\myData.dat using Windows distribution. case using gcamreport package following Docker installation: make sure data inside gcamreport folder. make sure type correctly path gcamreport folder running docker image (5th step Docker section) make sure pointing correctly data. example, gcamreport folder folder called amazingData dataset myData.dat, refer newline
code: > run("path/to/your/data/myData.dat") [1] "Loading project..." [1] "Loading data, performing checks, and saving output..." [1] "ag_demand_clean" Error in rgcam::getQuery(prj, "demand balances by crop commodity") :   getQuery: Query demand balances by crop commodity is not in any scenarios in the data set. # option 1: full path run("/app/amazingData/myData.dat")  # option 2: partial path run("amazingData/myData.dat")

title: gcamreport
text: Contents Introduction Installation Guide R Docker Getting Started Warning Error Messages

title: gcamreport
text: Back Contents gcamreport tool generates consistent dataset scenario run Global Change Analysis Model (GCAM), meets reporting requirements Intergovernmental Panel Climate Change (IPCC). Additionally, gcamreport includes interactive user widget allows users create download plots, well download reduced versions dataset table format.

title: gcamreport
text: Back Contents two equivalent possibilities make use package:

title: gcamreport
text: Requirements R (download click ) Rstudio (download click ) Git (download click ) Open git bash folder want clone repository clone : Load gcamreport package. two options: Open gcamreport folder just cloned double-click gcamreport.Rproj file. RStudio open project. Load library: Open Rstudio (matter Rproject) load library:  Now gcamreport package fully loaded. Enjoy! 😄
code: git clone  https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git install.packages('devtools') devtools::load_all() install.packages('remotes') remotes::install_github("bc3LC/gcamreport") #you can skip all updates in case you are asked library(gcamreport)

title: gcamreport
text: Requirements Docker (download click ) Git (download click ) Open git bash folder want clone repository clone : Open Docker Desktop (double-click icon computer) leave running background. Inside terminal (bash cmd) pull docker image: Note❗: step requires 13.5GB free space computer. Run Docker container using path gcamreport folder: prompt R terminal console. Install gcamreport package new R console: Note❗: local files accessed must inside gcamreport folder, considered now root directory R session. Inside R session, referred /app. Note❗: use docker image, can simply run steps 3, 5 6, since docker image already computer. Now gcamreport package fully loaded. Enjoy! 😄
code: git clone https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git docker pull claudiarodes/gcamreport_docker:v2 docker run -v /path/to/gcamreport:/app -p 4000:3838 -it claudiarodes/gcamreport_docker:v2 remotes::install_github("bc3LC/gcamreport") #you can skip all updates in case you are asked library(gcamreport)

title: gcamreport
text: Back Contents gcamreport package consists set functions divided two different blocks: Dataset generation: creates loads existing project automatically saves generated dataset meets reporting requirements IPCC. Main function: run(). information look tutorial type ?run R console. obtain warning error messages, might useful look Warning Error Messages section. Interactive user block: launches interactive widget display table format dataset, possibility filter, reorder, download live. Moreover, displays plots allows downloaded, aggregated variables, regions, scenarios. Main function: launch_gcamreport_ui(). information look tutorial type ?launch_gcamreport_ui R console. obtain warning error messages, might useful look Warning Error Messages section. Note❗: followed Docker installation, open user interface (UI) launched, either go Docker Desktop type last started port, type http://localhost:4000 browser.  addition, package includes default input files (.Rda), read different functions. can changed user. constants include energy shares, land shares, others.

title: gcamreport
text: Back Contents typical already-known errors can easily solved! 💡 💻 Error “run(”path///data/myData.dat”)” R console, might see error: problem due wrong path specification. Thus, make sure specified correctly path. addition: case using gcamreport package following R installation, try copy whole path data, instance C:\Users\username\Documents\path\\\data\myData.dat using Windows distribution. case using gcamreport package following Docker installation: make sure data inside gcamreport folder. make sure type correctly path gcamreport folder running docker image (5th step Docker section) make sure pointing correctly data. example, gcamreport folder folder called amazingData dataset myData.dat, refer  💻 Wired message launching UI using Docker installation. using functions run() launch_gcamreport_ui() launch UI, might get message: error! simply need either go Docker Desktop program click last started port  open url http://localhost:4000 favourite browser.  💻 Error using UI Docker installation. oppening localhost, might see error:  UI running. Try either use run() function launch_gcamreport_ui().  💻 Error related system using Docker installation. R console opened, might see message introducing command: Simply type Ctrl+C run command .
code: > run("path/to/your/data/myData.dat")   [1] "Loading project..."   [1] "Loading data, performing checks, and saving output..." title: run — run
text: Main function. Interacts user select desired variables report, loads , saves external output, runs verifications, informs user success whole process. Either `project_path` specified, `db_path` related items, `query_path`, `db_name`, `prj_name`, `scenarios`.

title: run — run
code: run(   project_path = NULL,   db_path = NULL,   query_path = NULL,   db_name = NULL,   prj_name = NULL,   scenarios = NULL,   final_year = 2100,   desired_variables = "All",   save_output = TRUE,   file_name = NULL,   launch_ui = TRUE )

title: run — run
text: project_path: full path project project name. Possible extensions: .dat .proj. db_path: full path database. query_path: full path query. db_name: name database. prj_name: name project. scenarios: name scenarios considered. final_year: final year data. default = 2100. desired_variables: desired variables report. Considered '' default. Otherwise, specify vector desired options, population_clean, GDP_MER_clean, GDP_PPP_clean, global_temp_clean, forcing_clean, co2_concentration_clean, co2_emissions_clean, tot_co2_clean, co2_sequestration_clean, ag_demand_clean, land_clean, primary_energy_clean, energy_trade_clean, elec_gen_tech_clean, elec_capacity_tot_clean, elec_capacity_add_clean, se_gen_tech_clean, fe_sector_clean, energy_service_transportation_clean, energy_service_buildings_clean, ag_prices_clean, industry_production_clean, elec_capital_clean, elec_investment_clean, transmission_invest_clean, CCS_invest_clean, resource_investment_clean, nonco2_clean, co2_price_clean. save_output: TRUE, save reporting data. save otherwise. file_name: file name saved data. used data saved. default, saved directory name specified project_path, 'ipcc_report' tag. CSV output. launch_ui: TRUE, launch UI, launch UI otherwise.
